description.para: Hooks for implementing an application-defined key store.

briefdescription.para: DPS_KeySymmetric.
DPS_KeyEC.
DPS_KeyCert.
A DPS key type.
NIST P-256 also known as secp256r1.
NIST P-384 also known as secp384r1.
NIST P-521 also known as secp521r1.
Allowed elliptic curves.
Symmetric key data.

simplesect.para: Need to define this outside of DPS_Key to satisfy SWIG.

briefdescription.para: Elliptic curve key data.

detaileddescription.para: Only x and y are needed for a public key. Similarly, only d is needed for a private key.

simplesect.para: Need to define this outside of DPS_Key to satisfy SWIG.

briefdescription.para: Certificate key data.

simplesect.para: Need to define this outside of DPS_Key to satisfy SWIG.

briefdescription.para: Union of supported key types.
An identifier of a key in a key store.
Opaque type for a key store.
Opaque type for a key store request.
Function prototype for a key store handler called when a key and key identifier is requested.

detaileddescription.para: DPS_SetKeyAndId() should be called to provide the key and identifier to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The request, only valid with the body of this callback function.

listitem.para: DPS_ERR_MISSING when no key is configured for this host

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for a key store handler called when a key with the provided key identifier is requested.

detaileddescription.para: DPS_SetKey() should be called to provide the key to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The request, only valid with the body of this callback function.
The identifier of the key to provide.

listitem.para: DPS_ERR_MISSING when no key is located

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for a key store handler called when an ephemeral key with the provided type is requested.

detaileddescription.para: DPS_SetKey() should be called to provide the ephemeral key to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The request, only valid with the body of this callback function.
The requested key type and parameters (e.g. key->type is DPS_KEY_EC and key->ec.curve is DPS_EC_CURVE_P256).

listitem.para: DPS_ERR_MISSING when no key is located

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for a key store handler called when the trusted CA chain is requested.

detaileddescription.para: DPS_SetCA() should be called to provide the CA chain to the caller.

parameterdescription.para: The request, only valid with the body of this callback function.

listitem.para: DPS_ERR_MISSING when no CA chain is configured

briefdescription.para: Provide a key and key identifier to a key store request.

parameterdescription.para: The request parameter of the handler
The identifier of the key to provide

simplesect.para: DPS_OK or an error

briefdescription.para: Provide a key to a key store request.

parameterdescription.para: The request parameter of the handler

simplesect.para: DPS_OK or an error

briefdescription.para: Provide a trusted CA chain to a key store request.

parameterdescription.para: The request parameter of the handler
The CA chain in PEM format

simplesect.para: DPS_OK or an error

briefdescription.para: Returns the DPS_KeyStore* of a key store request.

simplesect.para: The DPS_KeyStore* or NULL

The optional password protecting the key, may be NULL

Disable multicast send and receive on the node.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* DPS_AcknowledgementHandler) (DPS_Publication *pub, uint8_t *payload, size_t len)
memberdef.name: DPS_AcknowledgementHandler

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for a publication acknowledgement handler called when an acknowledgement for a publication is received from a remote subscriber.

detaileddescription.para: The handler is called for each subscriber that generates an acknowledgement so may be called numerous times for same publication.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque handle for the publication that was received
Payload accompanying the acknowledgement if any

briefdescription.para: Opaque type for a node.
Opaque type for a remote node address.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* DPS_OnLinkComplete) (DPS_Node *node, DPS_NodeAddress *addr, DPS_Status status, void *data)
memberdef.name: DPS_OnLinkComplete

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for function called when a DPS_Link() completes.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the remote node that was linked
Indicates if the link completed or failed
Application data passed in the call to DPS_Link()

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for callback function called when a node is destroyed.

parameterdescription.para: The node that was destroyed. This node is valid during the callback.

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for function called when a DPS_ResolveAddress() completes.

parameterdescription.para: The resolved address or NULL if the address could not be resolved
Application data passed in the call to DPS_ResolveAddress()

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for function called when a DPS_Unlink() completes.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the remote node that was unlinked
Application data passed in the call to DPS_Unlink()

briefdescription.para: Opaque type for a publication.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* DPS_PublicationHandler) (DPS_Subscription *sub, const DPS_Publication *pub, uint8_t *payload, size_t len)
memberdef.name: DPS_PublicationHandler

briefdescription.para: Function prototype for a publication handler called when a publication is received that matches a subscription.

detaileddescription.para: Note that there is a possibility of false-positive matches.

The publication handle is only valid within the body of this callback function. DPS_CopyPublication() will make a partial copy of the publication that can be used later for example to call DPS_AckPublication().
The accessor functions DPS_PublicationGetUUID() and DPS_PublicationGetSequenceNum() return information about the received publication.
The accessor functions DPS_SubscriptionGetNumTopics() and DPS_SubscriptionGetTopic() return information about the subscription that was matched.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque handle for the subscription that was matched
Opaque handle for the publication that was received
Payload from the publication if any

briefdescription.para: Opaque type for a subscription.
Get the key identifier of an acknowledgement, only valid with the body of the DPS_AcknowledgementHandler function.

simplesect.para: The key identifier of the subscriber, may be NULL

briefdescription.para: Acknowledge a publication.

detaileddescription.para: A publication should be acknowledged as soon as possible after receipt, ideally from within the publication handler callback function. If the publication cannot be acknowledged immediately in the publication handler callback, call DPS_CopyPublication() to make a partial copy of the publication that can be passed to this function at a later time.

parameterdescription.para: Optional payload to accompany the acknowledgement

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if acknowledge is successful, an error otherwise

briefdescription.para: Copy a node address.
Creates a partial copy of a publication that can be used to acknowledge the publication.

detaileddescription.para: The copy is not useful for anything other than in a call to DPS_AckPublication() and should be freed by calling DPS_DestroyPublication() when no longer needed.
The partial copy can be used with DPS_PublicationGetUUID() and DPS_PublicationGetSequenceNum()

simplesect.para: A partial copy of the publication or NULL if the publication could not be copied.

briefdescription.para: Creates a node address.

simplesect.para: The created address, or NULL if creation failed

briefdescription.para: Allocates space for a local DPS node.

parameterdescription.para: The separator characters to use for topic matching, if NULL defaults to "/"
The key store to use for this node
The key identifier of this node

simplesect.para: The uninitialized node or NULL if there were no resources for the node.

briefdescription.para: Allocates storage for a publication.

simplesect.para: The newly created publication, or NULL if creation failed

briefdescription.para: Allocate memory for a subscription and initialize topics.

parameterdescription.para: The number of topic strings to match - must be >= 1

simplesect.para: The newly created subscription or NULL if resources could not be allocated or the arguments were invalid

briefdescription.para: Frees resources associated with an address.
Destroys a node and free any resources.

parameterdescription.para: Callback function to be called when the node is destroyed
Data to be passed to the callback function

listitem.para: DPS_OK if the node will be destroyed and the callback called
DPS_ERR_NULL node or cb was null
Or an error status code in which case the callback will not be called.

briefdescription.para: Delete a publication and frees any resources allocated.

detaileddescription.para: This does not cancel retained publications that have an unexpired TTL. To expire a retained publication call DPS_Publish() with a zero TTL.
This function should only be called for publications created by DPS_CreatePublication() or DPS_CopyPublication().

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if destroy is successful, an error otherwise

briefdescription.para: Stop subscribing to the subscription topic and free resources allocated for the subscription.

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if destroy is successful, an error otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the uv event loop for this node.

detaileddescription.para: The only thing that is safe to do with the node is to create an async callback. Other libuv APIs can then be called from within the async callback.

simplesect.para: The uv event loop

briefdescription.para: Get application data pointer previously set by DPS_SetNodeData()

simplesect.para: A pointer to the data or NULL if the node is invalid

briefdescription.para: Get the port number this node is listening for connections on.

simplesect.para: The port number

briefdescription.para: Get application data pointer previously set by DPS_SetPublicationData()

simplesect.para: A pointer to the data or NULL if the publication is invalid

briefdescription.para: Get application data pointer previously set by DPS_SetSubscriptionData()

simplesect.para: A pointer to the data or NULL if the subscription is invalid

memberdef.argsstring: (DPS_Publication *pub, const char **topics, size_t numTopics, int noWildCard, const DPS_KeyId *keyId, DPS_AcknowledgementHandler handler)
memberdef.name: DPS_InitPublication

briefdescription.para: Initializes a newly created publication with a set of topics.

detaileddescription.para: Each publication has a UUID and a sequence number. The sequence number is incremented each time the publication is published. This allows subscriber to determine that publications received form a series. The acknowledgement handler is optional, if present the publication is marked as requesting acknowledgement and that information is provided to the subscribers.
Call the accessor function DPS_PublicationGetUUID() to get the UUID for this publication.

parameterdescription.para: The number of topic strings to publish - must be >= 1
If TRUE the publication will not match wildcard subscriptions
Optional key identifier to use for encrypted publications

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if initialization is successful, an error otherwise

briefdescription.para: Link the local node to a remote node.

parameterdescription.para: The address of the remote node to link to
The callback function to call on completion, can be NULL which case the function is synchronous
Application data to be passed to the callback

simplesect.para: DPS_OK or an error status. If an error status is returned the callback function will not be called.

briefdescription.para: Get text representation of an address.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses a static string buffer so is not thread safe.

simplesect.para: A text string for the address

briefdescription.para: Adds a key identifier to use for encrypted publications.

parameterdescription.para: Key identifier to use for encrypted publications

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if addition is successful, an error otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the local node associated with a publication.

simplesect.para: The node or NULL if the publication is invalid

briefdescription.para: Get the number of topics in a publication.

simplesect.para: The number of topics.

briefdescription.para: Get the key identifier of a publication.

simplesect.para: The key identifier of the publisher, may be NULL

briefdescription.para: Get the sequence number for a publication.

detaileddescription.para: Serial numbers are always > 0.

simplesect.para: The sequence number or zero if the publication is invalid.

briefdescription.para: Get a topic for a publication.

simplesect.para: The topic string or NULL if the publication or index is invalid.

briefdescription.para: Get the UUID for a publication.

simplesect.para: The UUID if publication is valid, or NULL otherwise

briefdescription.para: Check if an acknowledgement was requested for a publication.

simplesect.para: 1 if an acknowledgement was requested, otherwise 0.

briefdescription.para: Removes a key identifier to use for encrypted publications.

memberdef.argsstring: (DPS_Publication *pub, const uint8_t *pubPayload, size_t len, int16_t ttl)
memberdef.name: DPS_Publish

briefdescription.para: Publish a set of topics along with an optional payload.

detaileddescription.para: The topics will be published immediately to matching subscribers and then re-published whenever a new matching subscription is received.

Call the accessor function DPS_PublicationGetUUID() to get the UUID for this publication. Call the accessor function DPS_PublicationGetSequenceNum() to get the current sequence number for this publication. The sequence number is incremented each time DPS_Publish() is called for the same publication.

parameterdescription.para: Time to live in seconds - maximum TTL is about 9 hours

simplesect.para: DPS_OK if the topics were successfully published

memberdef.argsstring: (DPS_Node *node, const char *host, const char *service, DPS_OnResolveAddressComplete cb, void *data)
